[[File:Efez Celsus Library 3 RB.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Personification]] of wisdom (in [[Greek language|Greek]], "''Σοφία''" or "''[[Sophia (wisdom)|Sophia]]''") at the [[Celsus Library]] in [[Ephesus]], [[Turkey]].]]
    −
'''Wisdom''' is a deep understanding and realization of people, things, events or situations, resulting in the ability to apply perceptions, judgements and actions in keeping with this understanding. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that universal principles, reason and knowledge prevail to determine one's actions. Wisdom is also the comprehension of what is true coupled with optimum judgment as to action. Synonyms include: sagacity, discernment, or insight.
+
'''Wisdom''' is a deep understanding and realization of people, things, events or situations, resulting in the ability to apply perceptions, judgements and actions in keeping with this understanding. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that universal principles, reason and knowledge prevail to determine one's actions. Wisdom is also the comprehension of what is true coupled with optimum judgment as to action. Synonyms include: sagacity, discernment, or insight by many western veiws. Of the eastern, wisdom is that in which can only come from experuience and clarity. It can not come from books and teachings from others. It has to come with greater clarity of that is fully understood, and that one has come to know from personal experiences.
  +   +
In the book "The Psychic Wisdom Seeker Handbook", Wise Wolf commly refers to wisdom as something that can only be cultivate with deep clarity and clarity of that comes from ones life experience. He separates belief and wisdom by refer to belief as neither truth or falseness. And refer to wisdom as that one comes to know as truth by deep understanding and from what one fully knows from one's own experiences. One example is how does one know if spirits exist if one has never experienced spirit encounters? For him, he knows that they exist, for he has years of experience of spirit encounters. While those who believe in such, and never actually experience such, only know that is belief, and belief is not wisdom. Wisdom is truth, wisdom is knowing that in which is a certainty from ones own clarity from experience. He also teaches ego minds are limited to truth, for all remain a sleep in their own beliefs or delusions. In order to cultivate wisdom, one must explore for that truth other wise one's truth may be nothing more than belief.
